{"step_by_step_thinking": "Transmission assessment survey (TAS) is done to determine when infections have been reduced below target thresholds. It is a tool used to assess the impact of mass drug administration (MDA) and to decide when to stop MDA in an evaluation unit (EU). TAS is not used for assessing primary immunization coverage or for estimating birth rate, death rate, and infant mortality rate. Therefore, the correct answer is A. To determine when infections have been reduced below these target thresholds.", "answer_choice": "A"}
